title: Create widget component for homepage
description:
Create a generalized component widget for the home page. This widget should accept a svelte component that it will render. The widget will also have a modular layout system, that allows the same widget component to be used for many different sized widgets.

This widget component will be a wrapper that will handle the layout, and provide the svelte component with the necessary props to render itself. The component being rendered as a widget will be responsible for its own styling, and async/external requests, and should be designed to be used in a widget context.

The product goal is to have a generalized widget component that lets me show off the different endpoints that I'm creating. Currently I have a showcase widget, a cat gallery widget, a contributions widget, and a blog widget. I want to be able to use the same widget component for all of these, and be able to easily add new widgets to the home page.

title: Fix primary button text color in dark mode
description:
The primary button variant has dark text in dark mode, making it almost unreadable.

- Primary button text is dark-colored in dark mode
- Low contrast makes button text hard to read

- Primary button text should be light/white in dark mode for good contrast
- Should meet WCAG accessibility contrast requirements

- /src/lib/design-system/primitives/Button.svelte
- Check Tailwind dark mode classes for text color

## Fix
Ensure the primary button variant uses light text (e.g., `text-white` or `dark:text-white`) in dark mode.

title: Deploy site
description:
Deploy the portfolio site to Railway for SSR hosting.

## Why Railway
- SSR support with adapter-node (same adapter works for self-hosting later)
- No cold starts on free tier (/month credit)
- Minimal migration work when moving to self-hosted

## Implementation Steps

### 1. Install and configure adapter-node
```bash
npm install -D @sveltejs/adapter-node
```

### 2. Update svelte.config.js
```js
import adapter from '@sveltejs/adapter-node';

export default {
  kit: {
    adapter: adapter()
  }
};
```

### 3. Create Railway project
- Connect GitHub repo to Railway
- Railway auto-detects SvelteKit and configures build
- Set any required environment variables (GITHUB_FINE_GRAIN_ACCESS_TOKEN)

### 4. Configure production settings
- Set up custom domain (optional)
- Configure health checks
- Review Railway dashboard for resource usage

### 5. Verify deployment
- Test all routes (/, /blog, /contributions, /cats, /games, /design-system)
- Verify SSR is working (view source should show rendered HTML)
- Test GitHub contributions feature with production token

## Future Migration to Self-Hosting
When ready to self-host, the same adapter-node build can be:
- Run directly with `node build`
- Containerized with Docker
- Deployed to any VPS (DigitalOcean, Linode, etc.)

## Environment Variables Required
- GITHUB_FINE_GRAIN_ACCESS_TOKEN (for contributions feature)

deploy, production, railway, ssr, adapter-node
